aston.group17.model

Class Shop

  • java.lang.Object
    • aston.group17.model.Shop

  • public class Shop
extends java.lang.Object
    A Shop which handles shopping Drivers, if they are going to shop, and sends Drivers to the Till when they are done shopping
    Version:
    2017.4.25
    Author:
    Kieran Gates, Mitch Feaver

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shop(int amount)
      Creates a new Shop object with the specified amount of Tills

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      Gets all shopping Drivers to act while in Shop.
      void addNewDriver(Driver d)
      Adds a driver to the shop, who will begin shopping
      double countMoney()
      Adds all money gained from each till and adds it to moneyEarnt
      double countMoneyLost()
      Adds all money lost from lost sales from each till and adds it to moneyLost

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shop

        public Shop(int amount)
        Creates a new Shop object with the specified amount of Tills
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount of tills wanted

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Gets all shopping Drivers to act while in Shop. If Driver is done shopping they are moved into a Till and removed from the Shop

      • addNewDriver

        public void addNewDriver(Driver d)
        Adds a driver to the shop, who will begin shopping
        Parameters:
        d - Driver to add to the shop

      • countMoney

        public double countMoney()
        Adds all money gained from each till and adds it to moneyEarnt
        Returns:
        The amount of money made at all tills as of calling the method

      • countMoneyLost

        public double countMoneyLost()
        Adds all money lost from lost sales from each till and adds it to moneyLost
        Returns:
        The amount of money lost in extra shop sales
